Coordination is with the Jacksonville Fire Department, which visits the facility annually; the facility also plans to conduct internal drills on this process annually. 

VI. Planned Changes to Improve Safety
Jacksonville - Sunoco LLC will continue to improve employee training resources, conduct safety audits, and incident investigations, as applicable, to continuously improve worker and public safety. The facility will also continue to actively manage changes to facilities, process chemistry, process technology, and process equipment, as well as to review and revise operating, maintenance, emergency and communication procedures to ensure that they reflect current operating practices.

Executive Summary

I. Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response
Sunoco, LLC (Sunoco) is committed to the safety of our employees, surrounding community, and the environment. Sunoco's Jacksonville Terminal (Jacksonville - Sunoco LLC) achieved OSHA VPP Star status in 2013 and has maintained Star status. It is Sunoco's policy to comply with all federal, state, and local laws as well as accepted industry practice for the storage and handling of butane and other liquefied petroleum gases.  This commitment is demonstrated by the resources invested in accident prevention, such as training personnel and considering safety in the design, installation, operation and maintenance of the facility.
II. Description of the Stationary Source and Regulated Substances
Jacksonville - Sunoco LLC is a bulk liquid terminal. The terminal is an onshore, light products, bulk petroleum storage terminal used in the storage and distribution of petroleum products to retail and commercial end-users in the vicinity of Jacksonville, FL. The Terminal handles and stores various grades of unleaded gasoline, diesel fuel, ethanol, butane, and various other petroleum-based additives. 
The facility also handles butane as a   service for a customer. The butane is delivered to the terminal in trucks to a 60,000-gallon bulk storage tank. Butane is then blended on demand into gasoline trucks while they are being loaded.  Jacksonville - Sunoco LLC has one flammable material which exceeds the threshold quantities in the RMP regulation, Butane (C4). Based on the PSM coverage of the Terminal, the terminal has a Program 3 RMP.

III. General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps
The Jacksonville - Sunoco LLC maintains and RMP Prevention Program and complies with OSHAs PSM Standard.  Some elements of this program include: 
Training: Employees are trained in the safe handling of all products stored at the facility, including butane, and are trained in appropriate eme

rgency actions required in response to a potential release. Employee training includes participation in internal response drills with government agencies, including the U.S. Coast Guard and the Fire Department. Employees are trained and must demonstrate an understanding of the required tasks before being allowed to supervise the unloading of butane railcars.
General Risk Reduction and Safety Measures:
	Engineering and construction in accordance with recognized Industry and company standards.
	Equipment properly designed with protection from overpressure (pressure safety relief valves, etc.). 
	Updated technical drawings, piping & instrument diagrams and process flow diagrams.
	Operating systems monitored and controlled by trained operators.
	Computerized monitoring and control of process operation.
	Automatic and manual shutdown devices for critical systems.
	Scheduled inspection and testing of process equipment.
	Limited facility access and 24-hour operations.
	Frequent unit surveillance by operators.
	Automatic and remotely operated shut-offs to limit release quantity. 
	Strategically located valves to isolate leaks.
	Hydrocarbon gas detectors at key areas to warn of a chemical release. 
Facility Design: The butane handling facility has been designed to meet the standards set forth in NFPA 58 and is operated in compliance with the OSHA standard for the storage and handling of Liquefied Petroleum Gases (29 CFR 1910.110).

IV. Five-year Accident History
Jacksonville - Sunoco LLC has an excellent record of accident prevention.  There have been no accidental release of regulated substances, meeting the RMP five-year accident history reporting criteria, in the past five years.

V. Emergency Response Information
Jacksonville - Sunoco LLC has developed and implemented a written emergency action plan to protect worker and public safety as well as the environment. Operations staff are 24-hour trained and will shut the process down using only defensive actions p
